intro: Trembleya parviflora var. martii, commonly known as the Martii's small-flowered trembleya, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known.
